items.label: 539f72c2ec4f024411ecf503
items.description:
Service under this Schedule is available for separately metered single-family residences
in which energy for all water heating, cooking and clothes drying is supplied electrically.
Dwellings must have central electric systems for the primary source of space heating and
air conditioning.
Participation in the City's load management program is required for control of heat pump
compressors during the cooling season and water heater use in all months.
Alternating current, 60 hertz, single-phase three wire service at standard 240 volts is
available under this Schedule.
Minimum Charge: The monthly minimum charge shall be the "Basic Customer Charge".

When applicable, North Carolina sales tax will be added to all charges listed above.

Determination of On-Peak: 

1) On Peak demand will be the highest kW demand in any 15-minute interval of the current billing month during the following periods, Monday - Friday:

2) On-Peak kWh will be the energy used during the following periods, Monday - Friday: 

Standard Time 7:00 AM to 9:00 AM; Daylight Savings Time (Mar 11 to Nov 4)    2:00 PM to 6:00 PM.

All hours for Official Town Holidays will be considered as Off-Peak.
items.name: Residential service rate - time of use
items.utility: Town of Smithfield, North Carolina (Utility Company)
